channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: PEZA: POGOs are not BPOs
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: While the government has allowed Philippine offshore gaming operators to reopen after classifying them as business process outsourcing firms, the Philippine Economic Zone Authority clarified that POGOs are not considered or counted as BPOs.

item.title: Lawyers: Press freedom threatened by sedition, cyberlibel laws
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: While the Constitution affirms the protection of media workers under freedom of the press, this right is continuously being threatened by libel, cyberlibel and sedition laws, according to the Free Legal Assistance Group.

item.title: Senate to pass CITIRA for business recovery
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Senate is likely to pass the proposed Corporate Income Tax and Incentives Rationalization Act to help companies get back on their feet, and help jumpstart the economy that has been battered by the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis, senators said yesterday.

item.title: Congress resumes session today
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Congress will resume session today with lawmakers set to prioritize measures to help the country recover from the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis under a “new normal” that could slow down legislative proceedings.

item.title: Philippines suspends inbound commercial flights
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: The government has suspended inbound commercial international flights to the country for one week to help further mitigate the spread of the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: GCQ likely for Metro Manila after May 15 – DILG
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government yesterday expressed optimism that Metro Manila would be able to shift to a more lenient general community quarantine or GCQ after May 15.

item.title: Locsin hits PhilHealth premium payment hike for OFWs
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. yesterday hit the increase in the contribution of premium payments of overseas Filipino workers to the Philippine Health Insurance Corp.

item.title: Private firms team up to provide VCO to medical frontliners
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Private sector proponents of the health promotion and disease prevention benefits of virgin coconut oil are conducting their own informal study on the advantages and effectiveness of VCO to protect medical frontliners in both government-run and private hospitals from the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: ‘Balik Probinsya’ program should be divided into phases — Go
item.description: Sen. Bong Go urged concerned government agencies to ensure that enough preparations are in order for the implementation of the proposed “Balik Probinsya” program.

item.title: DILG receives thousands of SAP complaints vs barangay officials
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Over 2,000 complaints against barangay officials have been received by the Department of the Interior and Local Government over the social amelioration program or SAP.
